Title: An Exploratory Study on the Refactoring of Unit Test Files in Android Applications
Name: Assertion Roulette
Definition: A test method contains more than one assertion statement without an explanation/message (parameter in the assertion method)

Title: Bad smells and refactoring methods for GUI test script
Name: Duplicated Actions
Definition: Some duplicated actions appear in multiple places.

Title: Rails Testing Antipatterns: Fixtures and Factories
Name: Factories pulling too many dependencies
Definition: Calling one factory may silently create many associated records, which accumulates to make the whole test suite slow (more on that later)

Title: Pattern-based Smell Detection in TTCN-3 Test Suites
Name: Fully-Parameterized Template
Definition: All fields of a template are defined by formal parameters.

Title: The secret life of test smells-an empirical study on test smell evolution and maintenance
Name: Duplicate Assert
Definition: Occurs when a test case tests the same condition multiple times, which may increase test overhead.

Title: An approach to quality engineering of TTCN-3 test specifications
Name: Nested conditional
Definition: a conditional expression is unnecessarily nested.

Title: TEMPY: Test Smell Detector for Python
Name: Verbose Test
Definition: Long test method

Title: Anti-patterns of automated testing
Name: hard-to-write test
Definition: Making hacks that need an explanation or having complicated setups, so that a scenario can be tested

Title: xUnit test patterns: Refactoring test code
Name: Hard-to-Test Code
Definition: Another common cause, especially with "legacy software" (defined for our purposes as any software that doesn't have a complete suite of automated tests) is that the design of the software is not conducive to automated testing. This situation is described in more detail in its own smell section, Hard-to-Test Code

Title: Enhancing developers’ awareness on test suites’ quality with test smell summaries
Name: Mystery Guest
Definition: Consumption of external resources by a test such as, using a file which contains test data.

Title: Categorising Test Smells
Name: Fragile Test
Definition: The test does not compile or cannot be run due to changes in test-independent parts of the production code.

Title: Automatic generation of smell-free unit tests
Name: Overcommented Test
Definition: A test contains too many comments

Title: Utilising Code Smells to Detect Quality Problems in TTCN-3 Test Suites
Name: Missing Variable Definition
Definition: A variable or out parameter is read before a value has been assigned

Title: Pattern-based Smell Detection in TTCN-3 Test Suites
Name: Duplicate In-Line Templates
Definition: Two or more similar or identical in-line templates.

Title: Test Smell Detection Tools: A Systematic Mapping Study
Name: Indirect Testing
Definition: A test that interacts with a corresponding class by using another class.

Title: An empirical investigation into the nature of test smells
Name: Eager Test
Definition: A test is affected by Eager Test when it checks more than one method of the class to be tested, making the comprehension of the actual test target difficult.

Title: RTj: a Java framework for detecting and refactoring rotten green test cases
Name: Rotten Green Test
Definition: A test that passes (is green) but contains assertions that are never executed

Title: SoCRATES: Scala radar for test smells
Name: Mystery Guest
Definition: A test case that uses external resources that are not managed by a fixture. A drawback of this approach is that the interface to external resources might change over time necessitating an update of the test case, or that those resources might not be available when the test case is run, endangering the deterministic behaviour of the test.

Title: An exploratory study of the relationship between software test smells and fault-proneness
Name: Test Run War
Definition: A test allocates resources also used by others also used by others (e.g., tmp files)

Title: Unit Testing Anti-Patterns, Full List
Name: The Liar
AKA: Evergreen Tests, Success Against All Odds
Definition: A test doesn’t validate any behaviour and passes in every scenario. Any new bug introduced in the code will never be discovered by this test. It was probably created after the implementation was finished, so the author of this test couldn’t know whether the test actually tests something.

Title: Unit Testing Anti-Patterns, Full List
Name: The Free Ride
Definition: Rather than write a new test case method to test another feature or functionality, a new assertion rides along in an existing test case.

Title: Refactoring Test Smells With JUnit 5: Why Should Developers Keep Up-to-Date?
Name: Assertion Roulette
Definition: A collection of unexplained assertions in a single test method that, in the event of a test failure, challenge tracing which exact assertion had a problem

Title: Inspecting Automated Test Code: A Preliminary Study
Name: Obscure test
Definition: A test case is difficult to understand at a first reading.

Title: Smells of Testing (signs your tests are bad)
Name: No Assertions
Definition: A test that has no assertions only exists to lie about code coverage.
